column1: 8 pts - You identified marketing as a business function that could benefit from scrum/sprint methodologies, but it's somewhat unlikely. Good explanation of the process, but consider other functions that might be a better fit.
10 pts - Some vagueness in description, but largely OK. Good effort in explaining how scrum/sprint could operate for marketing function.

5 pts - Overly general description of poor fit; not specific to this function.

Comment: You mentioned some aspects of kanban, but the explanation of why it is a poor fit for the specific function could be more detailed and clear.
10 pts - Great job identifying the business function that could benefit from kanban and providing a detailed explanation of how it could be implemented. Keep up the good work!
12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how kanban could operate. Great job in explaining the possible columns and how it would benefit the function. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit.

Comment: Good attempt at explaining the poor fit of scrum/sprint for the chosen function, but could provide more specific details on why it's not suitable. Keep up the good work!

5 pts - Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation.

Great job identifying confirmation bias as a potential issue in this decision-making process. Keep up the good work!
10/10 - Excellent job defining confirmation bias and providing actionable steps to avoid falling into its trap. Keep up the great work!
12 pts - Complete and clear description of possible problem. Great job in providing detailed explanations and examples for both scrum/sprint and kanban methodologies. Keep up the good work!

8 pts - Reasonable description, but missing some detail. 

Your response provides a good understanding of the agile methodologies and their application to different functions within Mighty Jaxx. However, it would be helpful to include more specific steps or actions for implementing these methodologies. Keep up the good work!
